definitions.definition: The starting point of a fire.
Posture, or way of sitting, on horseback.
To put an object into a place where it will rest; to fix; to set firm.
definitions.example: Be sure to seat the gasket properly before attaching the cover.

definitions.definition: To provide with places to sit.
definitions.example: The waiter seated us and asked what we would like to drink.

definitions.definition: To request or direct one or more persons to sit.
definitions.example: Please seat the audience after the anthem and then introduce the first speaker.

definitions.definition: (legislature) To recognize the standing of a person or persons by providing them with one or more seats which would allow them to participate fully in a meeting or session.
definitions.example: Only half the delegates from the state were seated at the convention because the state held its primary too early.

definitions.definition: To cause to occupy a post, site, or situation; to station; to establish; to fix; to settle.
To settle; to plant with inhabitants.
To put a seat or bottom in.
